Abstract: The advent of player tracking technology has revolutionized sports analytics, providing unprecedented access to spatiotemporal data. This study explores the application of machine learning techniques to extract latent variables from player tracking data, enhancing our understanding of athlete performance and team dynamics. We develop a novel predictive model that integrates these latent variables with traditional statistics to improve forecasting accuracy in various sports contexts. Our approach leverages the rich spatiotemporal information to uncover hidden patterns and relationships within player movements and interactions. Results demonstrate significant improvements in predicting game outcomes, player performance, and tactical decision-making. This research contributes to the growing field of sports analytics by showcasing the potential of advanced data analysis techniques in extracting valuable insights from complex player tracking data.
